conclusion: Determine the length of the arc AC where light from point O cannot directly exit through AB or BC.
ABCO is a square, each side has length R. AC is an arc with radius R, O is the center.
Refractive index of the material is n = 2.
Critical angle θc for total internal reflection is 30°.
Light emitted from O towards arc AC hits the arc at various angles.
Find range of angles where light cannot exit due to total internal reflection.
Light undergoes total internal reflection if angle of incidence is greater than θc.
Angle of incidence is measured from the normal to the arc at the point of incidence.
Light undergoes total internal reflection if angle of incidence is between 60° and 120° from radial direction.
Arc length for this range of angles is πR/3.
Final answer: Length of the arc where light cannot exit is πR/3.
